captions.text: You have to be competitive, but if you’re too aggressive you’re tossed out of the course.
Just because you’re fast doesn’t mean you’re going to win. You need to stay chilled. That’s the most interesting part of the game.
When I heard Red Bull Mini Drome was coming to Japan, I instantly thought I wanted to take part. I had a lot of fun and I'm glad that I won.

title: World's Smallest Velodrome - Red Bull Mini Drome 2012 Japan

comments.author: MrBdenver

comments.text:
Clearly you haven't done this before. These bikes are nowhere close to 
5-6lbs. As for power to weight ratio, that has little to do with anything, 
this isnt a car. You are barely pushing anything in a flat circuit. Im 
going to stop replying, go do some research. Afterwards consider deleting 
your moronic comments.
comments.author: Andrew Yts

comments.text:
I've done this multiple times. Ever hear power to weight ratio? More weight 
is more to push. These bikes are 5-6 lbs
comments.author: Simba Tactical

comments.text:
Weight doesn't slow you down; rather more weight makes you faster 
(rotational inertia).  These bikes id say on average are around 20lbs (not 
too light in the cycling world), and the weight of the tires has little if 
nothing to do with it.
comments.author: Andrew Yts

comments.text:
+Andrew Yts
These bikes weigh next to nothing. thicker tread means more weight, slowing 
you down
comments.author: Simba Tactical

comments.text:
+FurryKristian the extremely low top-end speed of the track causes no 
difference. Thicker tires do provide more grip in this case. (Thinner tires 
will make a huge difference at speeds unattainable on this track).
comments.author: Andrew Yts

comments.text: More tire friction means less speed, so I guess it is a choice.
